post.content:
It doesn't work for me.
I changed  the Value to '1' from '0' but it doesn't work, though.


>Click 'Start' then select 'Run'.  Type 'regedit' (without the quotation) and click OK.  Then follow the key name, just like you drill down the folders in Windows Explorer.  Please check the screen shot below;
>
>http://www3.sympatico.ca/christopher_an/powerdown.jpg
>
>Double-click the Value name.  This will open a small document window for you to change the value.  Change and select OK to save it.  You don't need to save the whole registry while it keeps all changes as soon as you make a change.  This is good but bad because your mistake can make the computer a dormant without warning or anything.  This change is not critical at all and you can do it without worry.
>
>
>>I have the same problem.
>>But I have no idea how to find the value name you mentioned below.
>>Please help me out!
>>
>>>Try this.
>>>
>>>System Key: [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\\\SOFTWARE\\\\Microsoft\\\\Windows NT\\\\CurrentVersion\\\\Winlogon]
>>>Value Name: PowerdownAfterShutdown
>>>Data Type: REG_SZ (String Value)
>>>Value Data: (0 = default, 1 = power down)
>>>
>>>
>>>Change the value to 1 to power down after shutdown.
>>>
>>>If your PC has ACPI board the computer should power off even if the value is set to 0, but you have to manually set it if not.  Please let me know if this doesn't work.  Thanks.
>>>
>>>
>>>>누구 도움좀 주세요.
>>>>Shut Down을 해도 하드디스크는 Power off가 되질 않아서 매번 손으로 꺼야
>>>>합니다. 무엇이 문제인가요.
>>>
>>
>
